data.title: 100 Greatest Songs from 2007
data.meta_description: The year 2007 was a fantastic year for music, with a diverse range of artists and genres making their mark on the charts. One of the greatest songs of that year was "Umbrella" by Rihanna featuring Jay-Z. This song, which spent seven weeks at the top of the Billboard Hot 100, showcased Rihanna's powerful voice
data.meta_site_name: Singersroom.com - R&B Music, R&B Videos, R&B News
data.text:
The year 2007 was a fantastic year for music, with a diverse range of artists and genres making their mark on the charts. One of the greatest songs of that year was “Umbrella” by Rihanna featuring Jay-Z. This song, which spent seven weeks at the top of the Billboard Hot 100, showcased Rihanna’s powerful voice and catchy melodies, as well as Jay-Z’s lyrical prowess.

Other notable songs from that year included “Hey There Delilah” by Plain White T’s, a sweet and simple acoustic ballad that captured hearts around the world, and “Irreplaceable” by Beyoncé, a powerful anthem of self-empowerment and moving on from toxic relationships.

Kanye West also made a huge impact with his album “Graduation,” which featured hits like “Stronger” and “Good Life.” These songs showcased West’s innovative production style and clever sampling techniques, as well as his unapologetic lyrics.

Other notable artists from 2007 included Amy Winehouse, who released her critically acclaimed album “Back to Black,” and Daft Punk, who released “Alive 2007,” a live album that captured the energy and excitement of their electrifying live shows.

Overall, the music of 2007 was characterized by its diversity and creativity, with artists pushing boundaries and exploring new sounds and styles. These songs continue to be beloved by fans today and have become timeless classics in the world of music.

1. Irreplaceable – Beyoncé

“Irreplaceable” is a song by American singer Beyoncé. It was released in 2006 as the lead single from her second studio album, “B’Day”. The mid-tempo R&B song features Beyoncé calling out her unfaithful partner, telling him that he’s easily replaceable and that he should pack his things and go. The song’s catchy melody, strong vocals, and empowering lyrics quickly made it a hit, reaching the top of the charts in multiple countries. “Irreplaceable” has since become one of Beyoncé’s most iconic and beloved songs, frequently covered by other artists and used in popular culture.

2. Umbrella – Rihanna featuring Jay-Z

Released in 2007, “Umbrella” by Rihanna featuring Jay-Z quickly became one of the year’s biggest hits, spending seven weeks at number one on the Billboard Hot 100. The song’s catchy chorus and Rihanna’s powerhouse vocals made it an instant classic, while Jay-Z’s rap verse added a touch of swagger. The song’s metaphorical lyrics about the protective qualities of an umbrella in a storm made it an empowering anthem for listeners. The track also marked a turning point in Rihanna’s career, with her shifting towards a more edgy and experimental sound that she would continue to explore in the years to come.

3. The Sweet Escape – Gwen Stefani featuring Akon

“The Sweet Escape” is a pop song by American singer Gwen Stefani featuring rapper Akon. The upbeat track was released in 2006 and peaked at number two on the US Billboard Hot 100 chart. The song features a catchy chorus and a pulsing beat, with Stefani’s signature vocals and Akon’s smooth flow. The lyrics describe the desire to escape from a problematic situation and the need for independence. The accompanying music video features a colorful and playful aesthetic, with Stefani and Akon dancing and singing in a variety of whimsical settings. Overall, “The Sweet Escape” is a fun and uplifting pop anthem.

4. Big Girls Don’t Cry – Fergie

“Big Girls Don’t Cry” is a pop ballad by American singer Fergie. It was released as the fourth single from her debut solo album “The Dutchess” in 2007. The song talks about the emotional turmoil of a break-up and Fergie’s refusal to shed a tear over it. The lyrics are powerful, yet introspective, with Fergie singing in a more subdued manner than her usual energetic style. The melody is simple, but catchy, with a prominent acoustic guitar and piano accompaniment. The song was a commercial success, peaking at number one on the Billboard Hot 100, as well as several other charts around the world. It was also nominated for a Grammy Award for Best Female Pop Vocal Performance. Overall, “Big Girls Don’t Cry” showcases Fergie’s versatility as a singer and songwriter, and has become a timeless classic of the late 2000s.

5. Buy U a Drank (Shawty Snappin’) – T-Pain featuring Yung Joc

“Buy U a Drank (Shawty Snappin’)” is a hit song by American rapper and singer T-Pain featuring Yung Joc. The song is a perfect representation of the mid-2000s hip-hop sound with its infectious beat, autotuned vocals, and catchy chorus. The song’s lyrics revolve around T-Pain’s desire to spend time with a woman he finds attractive, promising to buy her a drink and take her home. The chorus features T-Pain’s signature use of autotune, which became a defining characteristic of his music. “Buy U a Drank (Shawty Snappin’)” became T-Pain’s first number-one hit on the US Billboard Hot 100 chart in 2007.

6. Before He Cheats – Carrie Underwood

“Before He Cheats” is a popular country song performed by American singer Carrie Underwood. The song, released in 2005, tells the story of a woman who discovers her boyfriend is cheating on her and decides to take revenge by vandalizing his car. The lyrics describe the protagonist’s anger and frustration as she smashes the headlights, carves her name into the leather seats, and slashes the tires with a knife. Underwood’s powerful vocals and the catchy melody of the song, combined with its themes of betrayal and revenge, have made it a favorite among country music fans and a classic breakup anthem.

7. Hey There Delilah – Plain White T’s

“Hey There Delilah” is a heartfelt ballad by the Plain White T’s. Released in 2006, the song tells the story of a long-distance relationship between the narrator and his love interest, Delilah. The stripped-down acoustic guitar and soft vocals allow the poignant lyrics to shine through, making it a timeless classic. The song became an instant hit, reaching number one on the Billboard Hot 100 and propelling the band to mainstream success. “Hey There Delilah” is a beautiful tribute to the power of love, even when miles apart, and has become a staple of romantic playlists around the world.

8. I Wanna Love You – Akon featuring Snoop Dogg

“I Wanna Love You” is a song by Akon featuring Snoop Dogg, released in 2006 as the second single from Akon’s second studio album “Konvicted”. The song features Akon’s signature R&B style and a catchy chorus, with Snoop Dogg adding his iconic West Coast hip-hop flavor. The lyrics are about Akon and Snoop Dogg trying to seduce a woman and convince her to leave her current partner for them. The song became a huge commercial success, reaching number one on the Billboard Hot 100 chart and remaining on the chart for over six months, cementing its place as a classic hip-hop and R&B collaboration.

9. Say It Right – Nelly Furtado

“Say It Right” is a popular pop song performed by Canadian singer-songwriter Nelly Furtado. The song, released in 2006, features a blend of pop, electronic, and world music elements. The lyrics describe the protagonist’s desire for emotional and physical connection with her lover, urging him to “say it right” and express his feelings honestly. Furtado’s smooth and sensual vocals, combined with the hypnotic beat and catchy chorus, create a sultry and seductive vibe. “Say It Right” was a commercial success, reaching the top 10 in multiple countries and solidifying Furtado’s status as a talented and versatile musician.

10. Glamorous – Fergie featuring Ludacris

Released in 2007, “Glamorous” is a catchy pop-rap anthem by American singer Fergie, featuring Ludacris. The song tells the story of Fergie’s rise to fame and her newfound glamorous lifestyle, with lyrics about designer clothes, private jets, and red carpet events. The chorus is an infectious earworm, with Fergie singing about how she’s “glamorous” and “flossy flossy” over a bouncy beat and catchy melody. The track was a commercial success, reaching the top 10 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart and earning Fergie a Grammy nomination for Best Female Pop Vocal Performance.

11. Don’t Matter – Akon

“Don’t Matter” is a popular R&B song performed by Senegalese-American singer Akon. The song, released in 2007, features a mellow beat and a catchy chorus that emphasizes the importance of love and emotional connection over material possessions. The lyrics describe the protagonist’s deep love for his partner, regardless of their background, and the struggles they face in pursuing their relationship due to outside pressures. Akon’s smooth and soulful vocals, combined with the song’s infectious melody, make “Don’t Matter” a romantic and uplifting anthem that resonates with listeners worldwide. The song was a commercial success, reaching the top 10 in several countries and cementing Akon’s status as a talented R&B artist.

12. Girlfriend – Avril Lavigne

“Girlfriend” is a pop punk/rock song by Canadian singer-songwriter Avril Lavigne. It was released as the lead single from her third studio album, “The Best Damn Thing”. The song features power chords and catchy hooks, which highlight Lavigne’s signature punk-pop style. Lyrically, the song is about a girl who wants to steal her crush away from his current girlfriend. It became a commercial success, topping the charts in several countries and earning Lavigne her second number-one single on the Billboard Hot 100. The song’s upbeat melody and sing-along chorus make it a classic anthem of the early 2000s.

13. Makes Me Wonder – Maroon 5

” Makes Me Wonder” by Maroon 5 is a groovy, upbeat pop-rock anthem with an infectious beat and memorable chorus. Adam Levine’s signature falsetto vocals soar over a driving bassline and a funky guitar riff, creating a catchy melody that’s hard to resist. Lyrically, the song is about a relationship that’s falling apart, and the frustration and confusion that come with it. The upbeat music contrasts with the melancholy lyrics, creating a bittersweet vibe that’s both danceable and emotionally resonant. The song’s slick production and catchy hooks helped make it a massive hit and a standout track in Maroon 5’s discography.

14. Party Like a Rock Star – Shop Boyz

“Party Like a Rock Star” is a popular rap-rock song performed by American group Shop Boyz. The song, released in 2007, features a heavy rock beat and catchy hooks that encourage listeners to let loose and enjoy the party lifestyle. The lyrics describe the wild and reckless behavior of rock stars, from driving expensive cars to throwing lavish parties and indulging in drugs and alcohol. Shop Boyz’s energetic and charismatic rapping, combined with the song’s infectious chorus, make “Party Like a Rock Star” an anthem of youth rebellion and carefree abandon that became a hit among fans of rock and hip-hop music.

15. Smack That – Akon featuring Eminem

“Smack That” is a hit song by Akon featuring Eminem, released in 2006. The song is a fusion of hip hop, R&B, and pop and features Akon’s signature catchy hooks and Eminem’s aggressive rapping. The lyrics of the song revolve around the theme of seduction, with Akon and Eminem trading verses about their respective love interests. The song became a massive commercial success, reaching the top 10 in over 20 countries and earning Akon and Eminem multiple award nominations. The collaboration between two of the biggest names in the music industry resulted in an unforgettable track that still resonates with listeners today.

16. This Is Why I’m Hot – Mims

“This Is Why I’m Hot” by Mims is a hip-hop track that became an instant hit upon its release in 2007. The song is characterized by its catchy chorus and its heavy use of repetition, particularly in the verses. The lyrics revolve around Mims bragging about his success, his money, and his appeal to women. The song’s production features a prominent synthesizer melody and a heavy bassline, creating an upbeat and energetic sound. “This Is Why I’m Hot” topped the Billboard Hot 100 chart and helped establish Mims as a rising star in the hip-hop world.

17. It’s Not Over – Daughtry

“It’s Not Over” is a popular rock song performed by American band Daughtry. The song, released in 2006, features a powerful chorus and intense guitar riffs that convey the pain and frustration of a failed relationship. The lyrics describe the protagonist’s struggle to move on from their past love and the hope that they can reconcile and start anew. Lead singer Chris Daughtry’s gritty and emotive vocals, combined with the band’s tight instrumentation, make “It’s Not Over” an anthemic rock ballad that resonates with listeners who have experienced heartbreak and the complexities of love. The song was a commercial success and helped establish Daughtry as a major force in rock music.

18. The Way I Are – Timbaland featuring Keri Hilson

“The Way I Are” is a dance-pop/hip-hop song by producer Timbaland, featuring vocals by Keri Hilson. The song is known for its infectious beat and catchy chorus, as well as Timbaland’s use of electronic sounds and Hilson’s sassy vocals. The lyrics address societal pressures to conform to certain standards, with Hilson proclaiming that she won’t change for anyone. The song was a commercial success, reaching the top ten in multiple countries and earning platinum certification in the United States. Its popularity was further boosted by its use in various films, TV shows, and video games.

19. Fergalicious – Fergie

“Fergalicious” is a popular hip-hop song performed by American singer Fergie. The song, released in 2006, features a bouncy beat and catchy hooks that showcase Fergie’s confident and sassy personality. The lyrics describe Fergie’s glamorous and stylish lifestyle, from her designer clothes to her flashy jewelry and cars. The chorus encourages listeners to be “Fergalicious” and embrace their own unique style and identity. Fergie’s playful and tongue-in-cheek vocals, combined with the song’s infectious rhythm, make “Fergalicious” an upbeat and fun track that became a hit on radio and in clubs. The song helped establish Fergie as a solo artist and cemented her status as a pop icon.

20. Crank That (Soulja Boy) – Soulja Boy Tell’em

“Crank That (Soulja Boy)” is a 2007 hit single by American rapper Soulja Boy Tell’em. The song became a viral sensation due to its catchy beat and accompanying dance moves, which helped to popularize the trend of creating dance challenges on social media platforms. The track features Soulja Boy’s signature style of rap, which blends trap beats with playful, often nonsensical lyrics. “Crank That” topped the US Billboard Hot 100 chart in 2007, and was later certified multi-platinum. It remains a popular party anthem and a notable moment in the rise of social media-driven music trends.

21. Give It to Me – Timbaland featuring Nelly Furtado & Justin Timberlake

“Give It to Me” is a popular hip-hop and R&B song performed by American producer Timbaland, featuring Canadian singer Nelly Furtado and American singer Justin Timberlake. The song, released in 2007, features a catchy beat and a memorable hook that showcases the three artists’ distinctive styles. The lyrics describe the trio’s success in the music industry and their desire for continued fame and recognition. Timbaland’s innovative production techniques, combined with Furtado and Timberlake’s smooth and soulful vocals, make “Give It to Me” an energetic and dynamic track that highlights the creative chemistry between the artists. The song was a commercial success and helped solidify Timbaland’s status as a leading producer in the music industry.

22. What Goes Around…/…Comes Around Interlude – Justin Timberlake

“What Goes Around…/…Comes Around Interlude” is a powerful, emotional track by Justin Timberlake. The song’s lyrics speak of a relationship that has gone sour, with the protagonist realizing that karma has come back around to him. The haunting melody, combined with Timberlake’s passionate vocal performance, conveys a sense of regret and sadness. The song features a string orchestra and a memorable guitar riff, creating a lush, cinematic sound that elevates the track to another level. “What Goes Around…/…Comes Around Interlude” showcases Timberlake’s ability to write and perform deeply personal and emotionally charged music.

23. Cupid’s Chokehold / Breakfast In America – Gym Class Heroes featuring Patrick Stump

“Cupid’s Chokehold/Breakfast in America” is a popular pop-rap song performed by American band Gym Class Heroes, featuring American singer Patrick Stump. The song, released in 2005, features a catchy melody and playful lyrics that describe the protagonist’s infatuation with a girl he has just met. The chorus samples Supertramp’s hit song “Breakfast in America,” adding a nostalgic and romantic touch to the track. Gym Class Heroes’ lead vocalist, Travis McCoy, delivers witty and relatable rhymes, while Stump’s smooth and soulful vocals add an infectious hook to the song. “Cupid’s Chokehold/Breakfast in America” became a hit on radio and in clubs, helping to establish Gym Class Heroes as a major force in pop and rap music.

24. How to Save a Life – The Fray

“How to Save a Life” is a poignant and emotional song by American rock band The Fray. Released in 2005, the song gained widespread popularity and became an instant hit. The lyrics tell the story of a person trying to help a friend who is struggling with a drug addiction, and the pain of not being able to save them. The song is driven by piano and guitar, with lead singer Isaac Slade’s powerful and emotive vocals conveying the raw emotions of the lyrics. “How to Save a Life” has since become an anthem for those struggling with addiction or mental health issues.

25. Home – Daughtry

“Home” is a powerful and emotional rock ballad by American musician Chris Daughtry, also known as the lead singer of the band Daughtry. Released in 2006, the song became an instant hit, reaching the top five on the Billboard Hot 100 chart. The lyrics speak to the longing for a place where one truly belongs, a place of comfort and safety, and the yearning to return to it. With its soaring vocals, driving guitar riffs, and heartfelt message, “Home” has become an anthem for those who seek to find their way back to where they truly belong.

26. My Love – Justin Timberlake featuring T.I.

Released in 2006, “My Love” is a hit song by Justin Timberlake featuring rapper T.I. The song is a blend of R&B, hip-hop, and pop and was produced by Timbaland. The song has a catchy beat and features Timberlake’s signature smooth vocals, backed by Timbaland’s distinctive beatboxing. T.I. adds a rap verse, complementing the song’s overall vibe. The lyrics of “My Love” describe the passionate feelings of a person in a romantic relationship, and the music video features Timberlake and T.I. in a futuristic setting. The song was a commercial success, reaching the top of the Billboard Hot 100 chart.

27. Stronger – Kanye West

“Stronger” is a popular hip-hop song performed by American rapper Kanye West. The song, released in 2007, features a driving beat and a memorable sample from French house duo Daft Punk’s hit song “Harder, Better, Faster, Stronger.” The lyrics describe West’s resilience and determination to overcome the obstacles he faces in life, including criticism from his detractors and the media. The song’s catchy chorus and West’s confident and charismatic rapping make “Stronger” an anthemic track that became a hit on radio and in clubs. The song helped cement West’s status as one of the most innovative and influential figures in modern hip-hop.

28. We Fly High – Jim Jones

“We Fly High” is a 2006 hip-hop song by American rapper Jim Jones. The track features a catchy chorus that became popular in the sports world and was often used as a celebratory anthem. Jones’ lyrics boast about his luxurious lifestyle and success, with references to flashy cars, designer clothing, and jewelry. The song’s production features a prominent horn sample and heavy bass, creating a club-friendly atmosphere. “We Fly High” was a commercial success, peaking at number five on the Billboard Hot 100 chart and earning a platinum certification from the RIAA.

29. U + Ur Hand – Pink

“U + Ur Hand” is a defiant and sassy pop-rock anthem by American singer Pink. Released in 2006, the song was a commercial success, reaching the top 10 in several countries. The lyrics are about a woman who is tired of unwanted advances from a man at a club and decides to reject him and enjoy herself on her own terms. With its catchy chorus, electric guitar riffs, and bold attitude, “U + Ur Hand” has become a feminist anthem, empowering women to take control of their own lives and reject societal expectations. The song showcases Pink’s powerful vocals and rebellious spirit, cementing her status as a pop icon.

30. Walk It Out – Unk

“Walk It Out” is a 2006 Southern hip-hop song by American rapper Unk. The track features a catchy hook and an uptempo, bass-heavy beat that encourages listeners to dance and move. Unk’s lyrics encourage listeners to “walk it out,” which refers to a popular dance style at the time that involves a series of moves, such as sliding and shuffling, to the beat of the music. “Walk It Out” was a commercial success, peaking at number ten on the Billboard Hot 100 chart and becoming a staple in clubs and dance floors across the United States.

31. Beautiful Girls – Sean Kingston

“Beautiful Girls” is a catchy and upbeat pop song by Jamaican-American singer Sean Kingston. Released in 2007, the song was an instant hit, topping the charts in several countries. The lyrics speak to the infatuation and admiration for a beautiful girl, despite the complications and challenges that may come with it. With its memorable melody, reggae-infused beats, and playful lyrics, “Beautiful Girls” has become a summer anthem, perfect for parties and beach days. The song showcases Kingston’s unique sound and laid-back style, making him a rising star in the music industry at the time of its release.

32. This Ain’t a Scene, It’s an Arms Race – Fall Out Boy

“This Ain’t a Scene, It’s an Arms Race” is a 2007 pop punk song by American band Fall Out Boy. The track features a catchy chorus and driving guitar riffs that blend punk rock and pop influences. The lyrics reference the band’s frustration with the music industry and the pressure to conform to trends and expectations. The title of the song alludes to the idea that the music industry is like an arms race, with artists constantly trying to one-up each other. “This Ain’t a Scene, It’s an Arms Race” was a commercial success, reaching number two on the Billboard Hot 100 chart.

33. Bartender – T-Pain featuring Akon

“Bartender” is a catchy and energetic hip-hop and R&B song by American rapper T-Pain, featuring Akon. Released in 2007, the song was a commercial success, reaching the top 10 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart. The lyrics speak to the desire to escape from the stresses of everyday life and find solace in the company of a bartender. With its infectious beat, Auto-Tuned vocals, and club-ready sound, “Bartender” has become a party anthem, perfect for dancing and letting loose. The song showcases T-Pain’s signature sound and talent for creating catchy hooks, while Akon adds his own style and energy to the track.

34. Pop, Lock & Drop It – Huey

“Pop, Lock & Drop It” is a high-energy hip-hop and dance song by American rapper Huey. Released in 2006, the song became a commercial success, reaching the top 10 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart. The lyrics encourage listeners to dance and move their bodies to the beat, with references to popular dance moves of the time. With its catchy chorus, infectious beat, and party-ready sound, “Pop, Lock & Drop It” has become a staple in the hip-hop and dance music scene, perfect for clubs and parties. The song showcases Huey’s charisma and talent for creating upbeat, catchy tracks.

35. Runaway Love – Ludacris featuring Mary J. Blige

“Runaway Love” is a 2006 hip-hop song by American rapper Ludacris featuring R&B singer Mary J. Blige. The track features a sample from the 1981 hit “It’s a Love Thing” by The Whispers and focuses on the issue of teenage girls running away from home to escape difficult situations. Ludacris and Blige’s lyrics tell the stories of three different girls dealing with abuse, neglect, and poverty. The song’s message aims to raise awareness of these issues and encourage empathy and support for those in need. “Runaway Love” was a critical and commercial success, earning praise for its socially conscious themes and powerful vocals.

36. Rockstar – Nickelback

“Rockstar” is a 2005 rock song by Canadian band Nickelback. The track features a catchy chorus and guitar riffs that reflect the rockstar lifestyle. The lyrics depict the fantasies of a narrator who longs for fame and fortune, with references to luxury cars, mansions, and private planes. The song’s tongue-in-cheek humor and self-awareness have made it a popular anthem for those who dream of rockstar status. “Rockstar” was a commercial success, reaching number two on the Billboard Hot 100 chart and earning multi-platinum certifications in several countries. However, it has also received criticism for perpetuating rockstar stereotypes and promoting materialism.

37. Thnks Fr Th Mmrs – Fall Out Boy

“Thnks Fr Th Mmrs” is an infectious and energetic pop punk song by American rock band Fall Out Boy. Released in 2007, the song was a commercial success, reaching the top 10 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart. The lyrics speak to a relationship that has ended but still holds sentimental value, thanking the other person for the memories they shared. With its catchy chorus, driving guitar riffs, and anthemic sound, “Thnks Fr Th Mmrs” has become a fan favorite, perfect for belting out at concerts and sing-alongs. The song showcases Fall Out Boy’s signature sound and dynamic energy, cementing their status as pop punk icons.

38. What I’ve Done – Linkin Park

“What I’ve Done” is a powerful rock ballad by the American band Linkin Park. The song was released in 2007 as the lead single from their third studio album, “Minutes to Midnight”. The lyrics explore themes of regret and redemption, with the band questioning their past mistakes and the impact they’ve had on the world. Musically, “What I’ve Done” is characterized by its driving guitar riffs, pounding drums, and soaring chorus, making for an emotional and anthemic experience. The song was a commercial success, becoming one of Linkin Park’s most recognizable and beloved tracks.

39. Summer Love – Justin Timberlake

“Summer Love” is a vibrant and upbeat pop song by American singer Justin Timberlake. Released in 2007 as part of his album “FutureSex/LoveSounds”, the track is a perfect blend of electronic and R&B elements, with Timberlake’s smooth vocals leading the way. The lyrics revolve around a passionate and carefree summer romance, with the singer recalling the excitement and intensity of falling in love during the warmest season of the year. “Summer Love” is a perfect feel-good anthem for anyone looking to capture the essence of a fun and flirtatious summer fling.

40. You – Lloyd featuring Lil’ Wayne

“You” is a smooth R&B song by Lloyd featuring Lil’ Wayne, released in 2007. The track’s mellow beat and sensual lyrics describe the intense feelings of love and attraction between two people. Lloyd’s silky vocals and Lil’ Wayne’s signature raspy flow complement each other perfectly, creating a memorable duet that explores the ups and downs of a romantic relationship. The song’s catchy chorus and memorable hook make it a classic of the late 2000s R&B scene, and a favorite among fans of the genre to this day.

41. Wait for You – Elliott Yamin

“Wait for You” is a heartfelt ballad by American singer-songwriter Elliott Yamin. The song was released in 2007 as the lead single from his self-titled debut album, and quickly became a hit with audiences worldwide. With its soaring chorus and emotional lyrics, “Wait for You” is a powerful love song that speaks to the pain of separation and the hope of reunion. Yamin’s soulful vocals and the song’s stripped-down instrumentation create an intimate and vulnerable atmosphere that draws listeners in. “Wait for You” is a timeless classic that has continued to resonate with fans over a decade after its initial release.

42. Last Night – Diddy featuring Keyshia Cole

“Last Night” is a smooth and sultry R&B track by American rapper and producer Diddy, featuring vocals from Keyshia Cole. The song was released in 2006 as the second single from Diddy’s album “Press Play”. With its seductive lyrics and catchy melody, “Last Night” tells the story of a romantic encounter that turns into a passionate love affair. Cole’s vocals add a soulful touch to the track, while Diddy’s smooth delivery and clever wordplay make it a standout hit. “Last Night” showcases the best of early 2000s R&B and hip-hop, and is a must-listen for fans of the genre.

43. Make It Rain – Fat Joe featuring Lil Wayne

“Make It Rain” is a 2006 rap hit by Fat Joe featuring Lil Wayne. With its catchy hook and pulsing beat, the song quickly became a club anthem and mainstream favorite. The lyrics revolve around the rappers’ financial success and their ability to throw around large sums of money. Lil Wayne’s iconic verse is particularly memorable for its rapid-fire delivery and clever wordplay. The music video, featuring a rainstorm of cash and luxurious settings, further emphasizes the song’s message of opulence and excess. “Make It Rain” remains a popular party song and a staple of mid-2000s hip hop culture.

44. Make Me Better – Fabolous featuring Ne-Yo

“Make Me Better” is a smooth and groovy hip-hop track by American rapper Fabolous, featuring R&B singer Ne-Yo. The song was released in 2007 as the lead single from Fabolous’ album “From Nothin’ to Somethin'”. With its infectious beat and catchy chorus, “Make Me Better” is a love song that celebrates the power of a supportive partner to bring out the best in oneself. Ne-Yo’s smooth vocals add a soulful touch to the track, while Fabolous’ sharp rhymes and flow make it a standout hit. “Make Me Better” is a classic of mid-2000s hip-hop and R&B that still resonates with audiences today.

45. Ice Box – Omarion

“Ice Box” is a melancholic R&B song by Omarion, released in 2006. The track’s slow beat and Omarion’s smooth vocals convey the pain of heartbreak and the difficulty of moving on from a failed relationship. The metaphor of an “ice box” highlights the emotional numbness and detachment that can result from a traumatic experience. The song’s emotional honesty and vulnerability struck a chord with listeners and helped establish Omarion as a solo artist after his departure from boy band B2K. “Ice Box” remains a beloved ballad of the mid-2000s R&B scene, and a testament to the genre’s enduring emotional power.

46. Lips of an Angel – Hinder

“Lips of an Angel” is a haunting and emotional rock ballad by American band Hinder. The song was released in 2006 as the second single from their debut album “Extreme Behavior”. The lyrics tell the story of a man who receives a late-night call from an ex-lover, and must confront the lingering feelings he still has for her. The song’s slow tempo and acoustic guitar riffs create a moody and intimate atmosphere, while lead singer Austin Winkler’s powerful vocals add a raw and vulnerable edge to the track. “Lips of an Angel” is a timeless classic of 2000s rock that continues to tug at the heartstrings of listeners today.

47. Waiting On the World to Change – John Mayer

“Waiting on the World to Change” is a 2006 pop rock hit by John Mayer. The song’s upbeat melody and catchy chorus contrast with its message of frustration and disillusionment with societal injustice and political apathy. Mayer’s lyrics express a desire to see positive change in the world, but also a sense of helplessness and resignation in the face of systemic problems. The song’s music video features footage of social and political movements throughout history, further emphasizing its message of activism and hope. “Waiting on the World to Change” remains a timeless anthem of social consciousness and a reminder of the power of music to inspire change.

48. Lost Without U – Robin Thicke

“Lost Without U” is a soulful and romantic R&B ballad by American singer-songwriter Robin Thicke. The song was released in 2007 as the lead single from his second studio album “The Evolution of Robin Thicke”. The lyrics express Thicke’s love and devotion to his partner, and his fear of losing her. The song’s slow tempo, lush instrumentation, and Thicke’s silky-smooth vocals create a dreamy and intimate atmosphere that perfectly captures the sentiment of the lyrics. “Lost Without U” is a timeless classic of 2000s R&B that continues to captivate audiences with its passionate and heartfelt message.

49. I’m a Flirt – R. Kelly (featuring T.I. & T-Pain)

“I’m a Flirt” is a 2007 R&B/hip-hop hit by R. Kelly, featuring T.I. and T-Pain. The song’s catchy beat and infectious hook make it a club favorite, but its lyrics describe a man who enjoys flirting with multiple women and has no intention of settling down. The chorus, delivered by T-Pain, emphasizes the carefree and playful attitude of the song’s protagonist. The music video features a series of vignettes showing Kelly interacting with various women, further emphasizing the song’s themes of flirtation and seduction. Despite its controversial subject matter, “I’m a Flirt” remains a popular party song and a testament to R. Kelly’s musical prowess.

50. If Everyone Cared – Nickelback

“If Everyone Cared” is a 2006 rock anthem by Canadian band Nickelback. The song’s powerful chorus and driving rhythm encourage listeners to come together and make positive changes in the world. The lyrics describe a world where everyone contributes to building a better future, and emphasize the importance of individual action in creating a more just and compassionate society. The music video features footage of real-world activists and advocates, further emphasizing the song’s message of social consciousness and activism. “If Everyone Cared” remains a beloved anthem of the mid-2000s rock scene, and a testament to the power of music to inspire positive change.

51. Get It Shawty – Lloyd

“Get It Shawty” is an upbeat and catchy R&B track by American singer Lloyd. The song was released in 2007 as the lead single from his second studio album “Street Love”. With its infectious beat and catchy chorus, “Get It Shawty” is a fun and flirty party anthem that encourages listeners to let loose and dance. Lloyd’s smooth vocals and clever wordplay add a playful and charming edge to the track. “Get It Shawty” is a classic of mid-2000s R&B that still gets people on the dance floor today, making it a must-have addition to any party playlist.

52. Face Down – The Red Jumpsuit Apparatus

“Face Down” is a powerful and emotional rock ballad by American rock band The Red Jumpsuit Apparatus. The song was released in 2006 as the second single from their debut album “Don’t You Fake It”. The lyrics tackle the serious issue of domestic violence, and urge victims to stand up for themselves and leave abusive relationships. The song’s slow tempo, heavy guitar riffs, and lead singer Ronnie Winter’s passionate vocals create a dramatic and intense atmosphere that perfectly captures the urgency of the message. “Face Down” is a timeless classic of 2000s rock that continues to raise awareness of a critical social issue.

53. The Way I Live – Baby Boy Da Prince featuring Lil Boosie

“The Way I Live” is a 2007 rap hit by Baby Boy Da Prince featuring Lil Boosie. The song’s upbeat melody and catchy chorus describe the rappers’ experiences growing up in New Orleans, Louisiana, and the challenges they faced in their lives. The lyrics highlight the importance of family, friends, and community in overcoming adversity, and the importance of staying true to one’s values and beliefs. The music video features shots of the rappers’ hometown and the devastation caused by Hurricane Katrina, further emphasizing the song’s themes of resilience and determination. “The Way I Live” remains a beloved anthem of Southern rap culture, and a testament to the strength of New Orleans’ musical heritage.

54. Shortie Like Mine – Bow Wow featuring Chris Brown & Johnta Austin

“Shortie Like Mine” is a 2006 R&B/hip-hop hit by Bow Wow featuring Chris Brown and Johnta Austin. The song’s infectious beat and catchy chorus describe the rappers’ admiration for a young woman who catches their eye. The lyrics emphasize her beauty, charm, and confidence, and the way she captivates the rappers’ attention. Chris Brown’s smooth vocals and Johnta Austin’s soulful chorus complement Bow Wow’s flow, creating a memorable collaboration that highlights the strengths of each artist. “Shortie Like Mine” remains a beloved party song of the mid-2000s R&B/hip-hop scene, and a testament to the enduring appeal of catchy pop hits.

55. It Ends Tonight – The All-American Rejects

“It Ends Tonight” is a powerful and emotional rock ballad by American rock band The All-American Rejects. The song was released in 2006 as the second single from their album “Move Along”. The lyrics describe the pain and heartbreak of a failed relationship, and the struggle to move on and let go. The song’s slow tempo, piano accompaniment, and lead singer Tyson Ritter’s heartfelt vocals create a raw and vulnerable atmosphere that perfectly captures the sentiment of the lyrics. “It Ends Tonight” is a timeless classic of 2000s rock that continues to resonate with listeners who have experienced the pain of a broken heart.

56. A Bay Bay – Hurricane Chris

“A Bay Bay” is a 2007 rap hit by Hurricane Chris. The song’s high-energy beat and catchy chorus describe the rapper’s love for his hometown of Shreveport, Louisiana, and the way he and his friends like to party and have a good time. The song’s title, “A Bay Bay,” became a popular catchphrase among fans and contributed to the song’s viral success. The music video features shots of Hurricane Chris performing in various locations around Shreveport, further emphasizing the song’s themes of regional pride and celebration. “A Bay Bay” remains a beloved anthem of Southern rap culture, and a testament to the power of catchy hooks and infectious beats.

57. Because of You – Ne-Yo

“Because of You” is a soulful and emotional R&B ballad by American singer-songwriter Ne-Yo. The song was released in 2007 as the lead single from his second studio album of the same name. The lyrics describe the lasting impact of a toxic and emotionally abusive relationship, and the difficulty of moving on and finding true love. The song’s slow tempo, lush instrumentation, and Ne-Yo’s powerful vocals create a haunting and intimate atmosphere that perfectly captures the raw emotion of the lyrics. “Because of You” is a timeless classic of 2000s R&B that continues to resonate with listeners who have experienced the pain of a broken heart.

58. I Tried – Bone Thugs-N-Harmony featuring Akon

“I Tried” is a 2007 hip-hop ballad by Bone Thugs-N-Harmony featuring Akon. The song’s emotional lyrics describe the rappers’ struggles with poverty, violence, and addiction, and their desire to break free from these cycles and build a better life. Akon’s soulful chorus emphasizes the pain and desperation in the rappers’ stories, creating a poignant tribute to perseverance and hope. The music video features footage of real-world struggles and tragedies, further emphasizing the song’s message of social consciousness and empathy. “I Tried” remains a powerful testament to the struggles faced by many in underprivileged communities, and a reminder of the importance of compassion and support.

59. Welcome to the Black Parade – My Chemical Romance

“Welcome to the Black Parade” is a grand and epic rock anthem by American rock band My Chemical Romance. The song was released in 2006 as the lead single from their album “The Black Parade”. The lyrics tell the story of “The Patient,” a character who dies of cancer and is led by a parade of death to the afterlife. The song’s dramatic orchestration, soaring vocals, and powerful guitar riffs create a sweeping and cinematic atmosphere that perfectly captures the grandeur of the concept. “Welcome to the Black Parade” is a timeless classic of 2000s rock that continues to inspire and excite listeners with its larger-than-life sound and message.

60. Shawty – Plies featuring T-Pain

“Shawty” is a catchy and upbeat hip-hop track by American rapper Plies, featuring fellow rapper and producer T-Pain. The song was released in 2007 as the lead single from Plies’ debut album “The Real Testament”. The lyrics describe Plies’ admiration for a woman he refers to as “shawty,” and his desire to spend time with her. The song’s infectious beat, catchy chorus, and playful lyrics create a fun and flirty party anthem that encourages listeners to let loose and dance. “Shawty” is a classic of mid-2000s hip-hop that still gets people on the dance floor today, making it a must-have addition to any party playlist.

61. Chasing Cars – Snow Patrol

“Chasing Cars” is a 2006 indie rock ballad by Snow Patrol. The song’s soft melody and emotive lyrics describe the depth of feeling between two people in a romantic relationship, and the way they feel lost in each other’s presence. The chorus, with its repeated refrain of “If I lay here / If I just lay here / Would you lie with me and just forget the world?”, became an instant classic, capturing the intimacy and vulnerability of romantic love. The music video features the band performing the song in a dark and moody setting, further emphasizing the song’s introspective and emotional tone. “Chasing Cars” remains a beloved ballad of the mid-2000s indie rock scene, and a testament to the power of raw and honest emotion in music.

62. Beautiful Liar – B’Day (Deluxe Edition) – Beyoncé & Shakira

“Beautiful Liar” is a sizzling collaboration between two of the biggest pop stars in the world, Beyoncé and Shakira. The song was released in 2007 as a single from the deluxe edition of Beyoncé’s album “B’Day”. The lyrics describe the seductive power struggle between two women fighting over the same man. The song’s upbeat tempo, Latin-inspired beats, and the vocal chemistry between Beyoncé and Shakira create an irresistible and danceable track that showcases the talents of both artists. “Beautiful Liar” is a timeless classic of 2000s pop that continues to captivate listeners with its sultry and infectious energy.

63. SexyBack – Justin Timberlake

“SexyBack” is a 2006 electro-pop hit by Justin Timberlake. The song’s futuristic beats and bold lyrics describe the singer’s confidence and swagger, and his desire to bring sexy back into popular culture. The chorus, with its iconic refrain of “I’m bringing sexy back / Them other boys don’t know how to act,” became an instant hit, solidifying Timberlake’s status as a pop icon. The music video features the singer performing in a sleek and stylish setting, further emphasizing the song’s edgy and avant-garde vibe. “SexyBack” remains a beloved anthem of the mid-2000s pop scene, and a testament to Timberlake’s creative vision and musical talent.

64. Keep Holding On – Avril Lavigne

“Keep Holding On” is a powerful and uplifting pop rock ballad by Canadian singer-songwriter Avril Lavigne. The song was released in 2006 as the lead single from the soundtrack of the film “Eragon”. The lyrics offer words of encouragement and support to those facing difficult times, urging them to persevere and not give up. The song’s slow tempo, piano accompaniment, and Lavigne’s emotive vocals create a poignant and heartfelt atmosphere that perfectly captures the sentiment of the lyrics. “Keep Holding On” is a timeless classic of 2000s pop rock that continues to inspire and uplift listeners with its message of hope and resilience.

65. Let It Go – Keyshia Cole featuring Missy Elliott & Lil Kim

“Let It Go” is an empowering and infectious hip-hop track by American R&B singer-songwriter Keyshia Cole, featuring rap legends Missy Elliott and Lil’ Kim. The song was released in 2007 as the lead single from Cole’s second studio album “Just Like You”. The lyrics describe a woman who has had enough of her unfaithful partner and decides to move on and let go. The song’s bouncy beat, catchy chorus, and the standout verses from Elliott and Lil’ Kim create a high-energy and fierce anthem that celebrates female empowerment and independence. “Let It Go” is a classic of 2000s hip-hop that still resonates with listeners today.

66. Apologize – Timbaland featuring OneRepublic

“Apologize” is a haunting and emotional pop ballad by American producer Timbaland, featuring OneRepublic lead singer Ryan Tedder. The song was released in 2006 as a single from Timbaland’s album “Shock Value”. The lyrics describe the regret and pain felt by a person after a relationship has ended. The song’s minimalistic production, with its sparse piano melody and stripped-down beats, creates a stark and melancholic atmosphere that perfectly captures the sentiment of the lyrics. “Apologize” is a timeless classic of 2000s pop that showcases the raw emotional power of Tedder’s vocals and the artistry of Timbaland’s production.

67. Bubbly – Colbie Caillat

“Bubbly” is a 2007 folk-pop hit by Colbie Caillat. The song’s soft acoustic guitar and gentle melody describe the simple joys of falling in love and feeling contentment in life. The lyrics, with lines such as “It starts in my toes, and I crinkle my nose / Wherever it goes, I always know / That you make me smile, please stay for a while now,” capture the innocent and carefree nature of new love. The music video features Caillat performing in a sunny and beachy setting, further emphasizing the song’s feel-good and summery vibe. “Bubbly” remains a beloved ballad of the mid-2000s folk-pop scene, and a testament to the power of uplifting and positive music.

68. Like a Boy – Ciara

“Like a Boy” is a fierce and empowering R&B track by American singer-songwriter Ciara. The song was released in 2007 as the lead single from her album “Ciara: The Evolution”. The lyrics describe a woman who challenges gender roles by behaving like a man in a relationship. The song’s catchy chorus, slick beats, and Ciara’s sultry vocals create a bold and unapologetic anthem that celebrates female strength and independence. “Like a Boy” is a classic of 2000s R&B that defies stereotypes and empowers women to embrace their true selves.

69. Who Knew – P!nk

“Who Knew” is a heartfelt and emotional pop ballad by American singer-songwriter P!nk. The song was released in 2006 as the second single from her fourth studio album “I’m Not Dead”. The lyrics describe the pain and regret felt by a person after losing a loved one. The song’s gentle piano melody, soaring chorus, and P!nk’s emotive vocals create a poignant and touching atmosphere that perfectly captures the sentiment of the lyrics. “Who Knew” is a timeless classic of 2000s pop that showcases P!nk’s exceptional songwriting skills and vocal range.

70. Never Again – Kelly Clarkson

“Never Again” is a 2007 pop rock hit by Kelly Clarkson. The song’s powerful guitar riffs and aggressive lyrics describe the pain and anger of a failed romantic relationship, and the singer’s determination to move on and find happiness. The chorus, with its repeated refrain of “Never again, will I hear you / Never again, will I miss you / Never again, will I fall to you / Never, never again,” captures the intensity and raw emotion of heartbreak. The music video features Clarkson performing in a dark and intense setting, further emphasizing the song’s confrontational and cathartic nature. “Never Again” remains a beloved anthem of the mid-2000s pop rock scene, and a testament to the power of music as a means of emotional release.

71. Promise – Ciara

“Promise” is a smooth and seductive R&B track by American singer-songwriter Ciara. The song was released in 2006 as the lead single from her second studio album “Ciara: The Evolution”. The lyrics describe a woman who promises to love and care for her partner unconditionally. The song’s sultry beat, hypnotic melody, and Ciara’s silky vocals create a sensual and romantic atmosphere that perfectly captures the sentiment of the lyrics. “Promise” is a classic of 2000s R&B that showcases Ciara’s versatility as an artist and her ability to create irresistible love songs.

72. Bed – J. Holiday

“Bed” is a 2007 R&B hit by J. Holiday. The song’s sensual and slow tempo, as well as its explicit lyrics, describe the singer’s desire to intimately connect with his partner. The chorus, with its repeated refrain of “Put you to bed, bed, bed / Don’t you worry ’bout a thing, baby,” captures the intimate and seductive nature of the song. The music video features J. Holiday performing in a dimly lit and intimate setting, further emphasizing the song’s sensuality and seductive tone. “Bed” remains a beloved slow jam of the mid-2000s R&B scene, and a testament to the power of music as a means of romantic expression.

73. Throw Some D’s – Rich Boy featuring Polow Da Don

“Throw Some D’s” is a 2006 hip-hop hit by Rich Boy featuring Polow Da Don. The song’s catchy beat and swaggering lyrics describe the rappers’ wealth and success, and their ability to attract attention with their flashy lifestyles. The chorus, with its repeated refrain of “I’m riding in something with a ‘million dollar’ body / I’m a young, fly, flashy nigga, a prince of the city,” captures the ostentatious and boastful nature of the song. The music video features Rich Boy and Polow Da Don showing off their cars and jewelry in a glamorous and glitzy setting, further emphasizing the song’s extravagant and opulent tone. “Throw Some D’s” remains a beloved anthem of the mid-2000s hip-hop scene, and a testament to the power of music as a means of self-expression and celebration.

74. Rehab – Amy Winehouse

“Rehab” is a 2006 soul-pop hit by Amy Winehouse. The song’s powerful lyrics and soulful vocals describe the singer’s resistance to seek help for her substance abuse issues, even in the face of pressure from friends and family. The chorus, with its repeated refrain of “They tried to make me go to rehab / I said no, no, no,” captures the defiant and stubborn nature of the song. The music video features Amy Winehouse performing in a simple and intimate setting, with scenes of her smoking and drinking alone, further emphasizing the song’s message of isolation and self-destruction. “Rehab” remains a beloved classic of the mid-2000s pop scene, and a testament to the power of music as a means of self-expression and reflection.

75. Big Things Poppin’ (Do It) – T.I.

“Big Things Poppin’ (Do It)” is a 2007 hip-hop hit by T.I. The song’s upbeat tempo and hard-hitting lyrics describe the rapper’s hustle and ambition to succeed in the music industry and in life. The chorus, with its repeated refrain of “Big things poppin’, little things stoppin’ / Big things poppin’, little things stoppin’,” captures the determined and confident nature of the song. The music video features T.I. performing in a flashy and dynamic setting, with scenes of him driving sports cars and surrounded by beautiful women, further emphasizing the song’s aspirational and celebratory tone. “Big Things Poppin’ (Do It)” remains a beloved anthem of the mid-2000s hip-hop scene, and a testament to the power of music as a means of self-motivation and empowerment.

76. No One – Alicia Keys

“No One” is a 2007 soul-pop hit by Alicia Keys. The song’s powerful lyrics and soulful vocals describe the universal desire for love and connection, and the joy that comes from finding that special someone. The chorus, with its repeated refrain of “No one, no one, no one / Can get in the way of what I’m feeling,” captures the empowering and uplifting nature of the song. The music video features Alicia Keys performing in a dynamic and colorful setting, with scenes of people from different walks of life coming together to dance and celebrate, further emphasizing the song’s message of unity and love. “No One” remains a beloved classic of the mid-2000s pop scene, and a testament to the power of music as a means of emotional expression and connection.

77. The Great Escape – Boys Like Girls

“The Great Escape” is an energetic and anthemic pop rock track by American band Boys Like Girls. The song was released in 2006 as the lead single from their self-titled debut album. The lyrics describe the longing for freedom and adventure that comes with youth. The song’s upbeat tempo, catchy hooks, and sing-along chorus create an infectious and uplifting atmosphere that perfectly captures the sentiment of the lyrics. “The Great Escape” is a timeless classic of 2000s pop rock that celebrates the spirit of youth and the desire for a life of adventure and excitement.

78. 2 Step – Unk

“2 Step” is a high-energy and infectious hip-hop dance track by American rapper Unk. The song was released in 2007 as the lead single from his debut album “Beat’n Down Yo Block!”. The lyrics describe a dance move called the “2 Step”, which involves a simple two-step motion with the feet. The song’s pounding beat, catchy hooks, and Unk’s rapid-fire flow create a lively and upbeat atmosphere that is perfect for dancing. “2 Step” is a classic of 2000s hip-hop that continues to be a staple at parties and clubs to this day.

79. Walk Away (Remember Me) – Paula DeAnda featuring The DEY

“Walk Away (Remember Me)” is a heart-wrenching and emotive R&B ballad by American singer-songwriter Paula DeAnda featuring the hip-hop group The DEY. The song was released in 2006 as the lead single from DeAnda’s self-titled debut album. The lyrics describe the pain of a woman who has been betrayed and hurt by her partner and decides to walk away from the relationship. The song’s haunting piano melody, soulful vocals, and The DEY’s powerful rap verse create a raw and emotional atmosphere that perfectly captures the sentiment of the lyrics. “Walk Away (Remember Me)” is a timeless classic of 2000s R&B that showcases DeAnda’s exceptional vocal range and emotional depth as an artist.

80. Go Getta – Young Jeezy featuring R. Kelly

“Go Getta” is a 2007 hip-hop hit by Young Jeezy featuring R. Kelly. The song’s upbeat tempo and motivational lyrics describe the rapper’s hustle and drive to succeed in the music industry and beyond. The chorus, with its repeated refrain of “I’m a go getta, I’m a go getta,” captures the determined and confident nature of the song. The music video features Young Jeezy and R. Kelly performing in a dynamic and energetic setting, with scenes of them surrounded by beautiful women and driving luxury cars, further emphasizing the song’s aspirational and celebratory tone. “Go Getta” remains a beloved anthem of the mid-2000s hip-hop scene, and a testament to the power of music as a means of self-motivation and empowerment.

81. Here (In Your Arms) – Hellogoodbye

“Here (In Your Arms)” is a 2006 indie-pop hit by Hellogoodbye. The song’s catchy melody and upbeat tempo describe the joy and excitement of being in love, and the longing to be close to someone special. The chorus, with its repeated refrain of “Cause here, here in your arms / I hope you’re here in my heart,” captures the romantic and tender nature of the song. The music video features Hellogoodbye performing in a whimsical and colorful setting, with scenes of them dancing and playing with giant balloons, further emphasizing the song’s joyful and carefree tone. “Here (In Your Arms)” remains a beloved classic of the mid-2000s indie-pop scene, and a testament to the power of music as a means of emotional expression and connection.

82. On the Hotline – Pretty Ricky

“On the Hotline” is a sultry and seductive R&B track by American quartet Pretty Ricky. The song was released in 2007 as the lead single from their third studio album “Late Night Special”. The lyrics describe a steamy phone conversation between two lovers who can’t wait to be together again. The song’s slow and smooth tempo, harmonious vocals, and sensuous lyrics create an intimate and alluring atmosphere that is perfect for a late-night rendezvous. “On the Hotline” is a classic of 2000s R&B that showcases Pretty Ricky’s signature style of provocative and sensual music.

83. Wind It Up – Gwen Stefani

“Wind It Up” is a 2006 pop hit by Gwen Stefani. The song’s upbeat tempo and catchy chorus describe the joy and excitement of dancing and having fun, while also paying homage to the classic children’s song “The Lonely Goatherd” from The Sound of Music. The chorus, with its repeated refrain of “Wind it up,” captures the playful and carefree nature of the song. The music video features Stefani performing in a colorful and whimsical setting, with scenes of her dressed in various playful outfits and leading a group of dancers. “Wind It Up” remains a beloved classic of the mid-2000s pop scene, and a testament to Stefani’s unique and playful style.

84. Cyclone – Baby Bash featuring T-Pain

“Cyclone” is a 2007 hip-hop hit by Baby Bash featuring T-Pain. The song’s pulsating beat and catchy chorus describe the irresistible attraction between two people, and the physical sensations that come with being close to each other. The chorus, with its repeated refrain of “She moves her body like a cyclone,” captures the seductive and sensual nature of the song. The music video features Baby Bash and T-Pain performing in a colorful and vibrant setting, with scenes of them surrounded by beautiful women dancing and gyrating, further emphasizing the song’s sensual and erotic tone. “Cyclone” remains a beloved classic of the mid-2000s hip-hop scene, and a testament to the power of music as a means of expressing desire and passion.

85. Break It Off – Rihanna & Sean Paul

“Break It Off” is a reggae-infused and upbeat dancehall track by Barbadian singer Rihanna and Jamaican rapper Sean Paul. The song was released in 2006 as a single from Rihanna’s second studio album “A Girl like Me”. The lyrics describe a couple who are caught in a cycle of on-again, off-again love and lust, unable to resist the temptation of each other. The song’s catchy hook, Rihanna’s smooth vocals, and Sean Paul’s rapid-fire flow create a lively and infectious atmosphere that is perfect for dancing. “Break It Off” is a classic of 2000s dancehall that showcases Rihanna’s versatility as an artist.

86. First Time – Lifehouse

“First Time” is an emotive and earnest alternative rock ballad by American band Lifehouse. The song was released in 2007 as the lead single from their fourth studio album “Who We Are”. The lyrics describe the euphoric feeling of falling in love for the first time and the uncertainty that comes with it. The song’s soaring chorus, melodic guitar riffs, and lead singer Jason Wade’s heartfelt vocals create a stirring and emotional atmosphere that resonates with listeners. “First Time” is a poignant and relatable song that captures the magic and vulnerability of a first love.

87. Ayo Technology – 50 Cent featuring Justin Timberlake & Timbaland

“Ayo Technology” is a 2007 hip-hop hit by 50 Cent featuring Justin Timberlake and Timbaland. The song’s smooth beat and sultry chorus describe the irresistible attraction between two people and the longing to connect in a physical way in the digital age. The chorus, with its repeated refrain of “Ayo, I’m tired of using technology,” captures the seductive and erotic nature of the song. The music video features 50 Cent, Timberlake, and Timbaland performing in a futuristic and stylish setting, with scenes of them surrounded by beautiful women and advanced technology. “Ayo Technology” remains a popular and classic hit of the mid-2000s hip-hop scene, and a testament to the power of music as a means of expressing desire and longing.

88. Outta My System – Bow Wow featuring T-Pain & Johntá Austin

“Outta My System” is a 2007 hip-hop hit by Bow Wow featuring T-Pain and Johntá Austin. The song’s upbeat tempo and catchy chorus describe the process of moving on from a past relationship and trying to forget someone who was once an important part of your life. The chorus, with its repeated refrain of “I gotta get you outta my system,” captures the feelings of heartache and determination to move forward. The music video features Bow Wow and T-Pain performing in a colorful and energetic setting, with scenes of them surrounded by beautiful women and flashing lights. “Outta My System” remains a beloved classic of the mid-2000s hip-hop scene, and a testament to the power of music to help heal a broken heart.

89. Teardrops On My Guitar – Taylor Swift

“Teardrops On My Guitar” is a country-pop ballad by American singer-songwriter Taylor Swift. The song was released in 2007 as the second single from her self-titled debut album. The lyrics describe the pain of unrequited love and the feeling of watching the person you love fall for someone else. The song’s catchy chorus, gentle acoustic guitar, and Swift’s vulnerable vocals create a bittersweet and relatable atmosphere that captures the heartache of teenage romance. “Teardrops On My Guitar” is a timeless and beloved song that showcases Swift’s talent for crafting heartfelt and catchy pop-country tunes.

90. Shut Up and Drive – Rihanna

“Shut Up and Drive” is an electrifying pop-rock song by Rihanna, released in 2007. The track’s fast-paced rhythm and catchy lyrics describe the thrill of speeding down the highway with a lover, and the urgency to escape everyday life. The chorus, with its repeated refrain of “Shut up and drive, drive, drive,” captures the rebellious spirit of the song and adds to its catchy appeal. The music video features Rihanna driving a vintage car and performing in a futuristic setting, surrounded by flashing lights and pyrotechnics. “Shut Up and Drive” remains one of Rihanna’s most beloved hits and a classic of the late 2000s pop scene.

91. Snow (Hey Oh – Red Hot Chili Peppers

“Snow (Hey Oh)” is a 2006 alternative rock song by Red Hot Chili Peppers that showcases the band’s signature sound of driving rhythms, funky basslines, and soulful lyrics. The track’s dreamy melody is anchored by an ethereal guitar riff and features lead singer Anthony Kiedis’ emotive vocals. The song’s lyrics are introspective, with Kiedis singing about the search for love and meaning amidst life’s hardships. “Snow (Hey Oh)” was a commercial and critical success and won the band two Grammy Awards. Its memorable chorus and uplifting message continue to make it a favorite among fans of alternative rock.

92. Money Maker – Ludacris featuring Pharrell

“Money Maker” is a lively and upbeat hip-hop track by American rapper Ludacris featuring singer-producer Pharrell Williams. The song was released in 2006 as the lead single from Ludacris’ album “Release Therapy”. The lyrics celebrate the power of money and the seductive appeal of a confident woman. The song’s catchy hook, funky beat, and Ludacris’ signature flow create a danceable and infectious atmosphere that has become a staple of 2000s party playlists. “Money Maker” is a fun and playful song that showcases Ludacris’ humor and charisma and Pharrell’s talent for crafting irresistible hooks.

93. Kiss Kiss – Chris Brown featuring T-Pain

“Kiss Kiss” is a catchy and upbeat R&B/hip-hop song by American singer Chris Brown featuring rapper T-Pain. The song was released in 2007 as the lead single from Brown’s second studio album “Exclusive”. The lyrics describe the thrill and excitement of a new romance, with Brown and T-Pain trading verses and harmonizing over a bouncy beat and catchy synth hooks. “Kiss Kiss” became a massive commercial success, topping charts around the world and cementing Chris Brown’s status as one of the most promising young talents in contemporary R&B. The song is a fun and infectious ode to young love and flirtation.

94. Far Away – Nickelback

“Far Away” is a power ballad by Canadian rock band Nickelback, released in 2005. The song is a romantic ballad with a slow tempo and features lead singer Chad Kroeger’s raspy vocals. The lyrics describe a long-distance relationship, with the narrator longing to be reunited with his partner. The song’s simple melody is accompanied by acoustic guitar and piano, creating a sense of intimacy and vulnerability. “Far Away” was a commercial success and reached the top ten in several countries. It has become a popular choice for weddings and other romantic occasions, and remains a staple of Nickelback’s live performances.

95. Rock Yo Hips – Crime Mob featuring Lil Scrappy

“Rock Yo Hips” is a crunk and snap song by American hip hop group Crime Mob, featuring rapper Lil Scrappy. Released in 2007, the song features a pulsating beat with catchy, repetitive hooks and lyrics encouraging listeners to dance and move their hips. The song’s production is characterized by the use of electronic synths and samples, combined with heavy drums and percussion. The song was a commercial success, reaching the top 40 of the US Billboard Hot 100 and receiving significant airplay on urban radio stations. “Rock Yo Hips” remains a popular party anthem and dance track to this day.

96. LoveStoned – Justin Timberlake

“LoveStoned” is an uptempo dance-pop song by American singer-songwriter Justin Timberlake, released in 2007. The song’s production, handled by Timbaland, features layered synths and drums with a driving beat that is both catchy and danceable. The lyrics speak of infatuation and romantic obsession, with Timberlake’s smooth vocals adding to the song’s sensuality. The chorus is a standout moment, with Timberlake’s falsetto and the song’s driving beat coming together in a euphoric release. “LoveStoned” was a commercial success, peaking at number 17 on the US Billboard Hot 100, and has become a fan favorite in Timberlake’s live shows.

97. Better Than Me – Hinder

“Better Than Me” is a heart-wrenching and emotional rock ballad by American band Hinder. The song was released in 2007 as the third single from their debut album “Extreme Behavior”. The lyrics explore the pain and regret of a failed relationship, with lead vocalist Austin Winkler expressing his feelings of inadequacy and disappointment in himself for not being able to make the relationship work. The song’s soaring chorus and powerful guitar riffs create a dramatic and intense atmosphere, making it a staple of rock ballad playlists. “Better Than Me” is a poignant and relatable anthem for anyone who has experienced the pain of lost love.

98. Paralyzer – Finger Eleven

“Paralyzer” is a catchy and upbeat rock song by Canadian band Finger Eleven. Released in 2007, it became the band’s biggest hit and a staple of alternative rock radio. The song’s funky guitar riff and infectious beat create a memorable and danceable groove, while the lyrics explore the feeling of being stuck in a rut and wanting to break free. The chorus, with its soaring melody and sing-along lyrics, is a powerful anthem of empowerment and motivation. “Paralyzer” is a feel-good and energetic rock song that showcases Finger Eleven’s unique style and catchy songwriting.

99. That’s That S**t – Snoop Dogg featuring R. Kelly

“That’s That St” is a collaborative hip-hop and R&B song by Snoop Dogg and R. Kelly. Released in 2006, the song is a smooth and laid-back track with a catchy melody and groove that is typical of Snoop Dogg’s signature West Coast style. The lyrics depict a luxurious lifestyle with references to fancy cars, expensive jewelry, and beautiful women. R. Kelly’s soulful voice adds a seductive and romantic touch to the song’s chorus, making it a popular choice for slow jams and R&B playlists. “That’s That St” is a chilled-out and catchy collaboration that showcases the strengths of both artists.

100. Same Girl – R. Kelly Duet With Usher

“Same Girl” is a collaborative R&B song by American singers R. Kelly and Usher. Released in 2007, the track revolves around two friends realizing they are dating the same woman, who they both believed to be faithful. The song’s catchy hook, “We messing with the same girl, the same girl,” is accompanied by smooth vocal performances from both artists, as well as a groovy beat and funky guitar riffs. Despite its controversial subject matter, “Same Girl” became a hit, reaching the top 20 on the US Billboard Hot 100 chart and earning critical acclaim for its slick production and vocal harmonies.
